Title: Break-in-a-narrative
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Break-in-a-narrative (interrupted speech) occurs when a phrase is broken into parts due to logical or emotional reasons.

When the syntactical structure of the fragmented sentence is disturbed, the device is percieved as defective. In writing, breaks are indicated by commas, suspension points or dashes.

examples:

  • What-did-you-call-me?
  • We are-not-making-no-changes-whatsoever!
